abstract.t: This memo defines two new Multi Topology Routing Identifiers (MT IDs) in Intermediate System to Intermediate System (M-ISIS, [RFC5120]). These new M-ISIS topologies are meant to convey routing information which is restricted to IPv4-mapped IPv6 addresses [I-D.ietf-behave-address-format]. The ultimate goal of instantiating dedicated topologies for IPv4-mapped IPv6 is to isolate the native IPv6 routing table from the IPv4 and to prevent from being overloaded by the IPv4-mapped one. This isolation is motivated also from an operational perspective to enforce specific engineering policies for each topology.
